jx.jx_en_mean: drain someone of all their money or resources
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使耗尽财富，榨干（某人）的钱财

jx.jx_en_mean: used ironically to express the speaker's belief that the person referred to does not deserve the sympathetic response they are seeking
jx.jx_cn_mean: (讽)我（为你）心碎，伤心（表示说话人认为对方根本不值得同情）

lj.lj_ly: ‘I flew out here feeling tired and overworked.’ ‘My heart bleeds for you!’ she replied.
lj.lj_ls: "我是乘飞机过来的，一路上觉得非常劳累。""我真为你伤心。"她答道。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  blēdan, of Germanic origin; related to blood

entry.def: When you bleed, you lose blood from your body as a result of injury or illness.

example.ex: His head had struck the sink and was bleeding...
example.tran: 他的头撞到了水槽上，正在流血。

entry.def: If the colour of one substance bleeds into the colour of another substance that it is touching, it goes into the other thing so that its colour changes in an undesirable way.

example.ex: The colouring pigments from the skins are not allowed to bleed into the grape juice.
example.tran: 外皮上的色素不能渗到葡萄汁里面去。

entry.def: If someone is being bled, money or other resources are gradually being taken away from them.

example.ex: We have been gradually bled for twelve years...
example.tran: 我们被一点一滴地压榨了12年。

example.ex: They mean to bleed the British to the utmost.
example.tran: 他们要最大限度地榨取英国人的财富。

entry.def: If someone is being bled dry or is being bled white, all of their money or other resources are gradually being taken away from them.

example.ex: The war has bled the once-strong Armenian economy dry.
example.tran: 战争榨干了原本繁荣的亚美尼亚经济。

sentences.sentence: "In the old days, doctors routinely bled patients as part of the treatment"

means.word_mean: 3. get or extort (money or other possessions) from someone;

sentences.sentence: "They bled me dry--I have nothing left!"
"These dyes and colors are guaranteed not to run"
